com.pi4j.component.adafruithat

Class AdafruitHat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pi4j.component.adafruithat.AdafruitHat
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdafruitMotorHat, AdafruitServoHat

    public class AdafruitHat
extends java.lang.Object
    This supper class developed to interface with both the "Adafruit DC and Stepper Motor HAT" and the "Adafruit Servo HAT" developed for the Raspberry Pi. Look below for technical details on the Adafruit Motor and Servo HATs.

    See MotorHAT

    See ServoHAT

    These two HATs use the same PCA9685 PWM chip for operating servos or motors. The "AdafuitMotorHat" and "AdafruitServoHat" classes extend this class to handle the particulars of motor and servo commanding.

    The PCA9685 chip was designed to handle LEDs through PWM control. However, the chip is used on the Adafruit HATs to control motors and servos. To remain consistent, the chip's address naming scheme used here is identical to the scheme found in the PCA9685 Product Data Sheet, Rev 4 - 16 April 2015.

    Author:
    Eric Eliason
    See Also:
    AdafruitMotorHat, AdafruitServoHat

    • Field Detail

      • frequency

        public double frequency
        Pulse width frequency of PWM. On first power up of a Adafruit HAT the default frequency for the PCA9685 chip is 200 Hz.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdafruitHat

        public AdafruitHat(int deviceAddr)
        Pass AdafruitHat device address to constructor. Note up to 32 unique HATs can be stacked on the Raspberry Pi. Each requires a unique device address that can be set by solder points on the HAT.
        Parameters:
        deviceAddr - Valid addresses range 0X60 to 0X7F

      • AdafruitHat

        public AdafruitHat(int deviceAddr,
                   int i2cBus)
        Pass I2C Bus number and Adafruit Hat device address to constructor. Note up to 32 unique HATs can be stacked on the Raspberry Pi. Each requires a unique device address that can be set by solder points on the hat.
        Parameters:
        deviceAddr - Valid addresses range 0X60 to 0X7F
        i2cBus - Valid bus numbers are I2CBus.BUS_1 or I2CBus.BUS_2

    • Method Detail

      • setPwmFreq

        public void setPwmFreq(double frequency)
        Set the PCA9685 pulse frequency
        Parameters:
        frequency - valid range 24HZ to 1526HZ

      • write

        public void write(int addr,
                  byte value)
        Write the 8-bit value to the indicated address
        Parameters:
        addr - Register address I2C device
        value - Value to write at register address

      • sleep

        public void sleep(long milliseconds)
        Sleep and force all motors or servos to stop if interrupted.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - Sleep time

      • stopAll

        public void stopAll()
        Stop all motors and servos for this Adafruit HAT.
